Player History
Signed as a free agent by New York (M) on 4/3/1985 to a minor league deal...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1985, off Kevin Gross (PHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/3/1985, off Scott Sanderson (CHC)...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $414,286 through salary arbitration...
Won World Series with New York (M) in 1986...
2/2/1987: Gets a new one-year contract worth $614,286 through salary arbitration...
Signed as a free agent by New York (M) on 2/4/1988 to a 2-year deal worth $4,000,000 per year...
Won World Series with New York (M) in 1989...
Signed as a free agent by Pittsburgh on 2/21/1990 to a 2-year deal worth $2,000,000 per year...
Traded from Pittsburgh to Philadelphia on 7/5/1990 (Going to PIT: LF Von Hayes. Going to PHI: RF Kevin Bass)...
Injured on 6/4/1991 with a Strained Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 5 weeks...
